alert.note: Alert for Blount Smoky Mountains (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 9:08PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Blount and Monroe Counties through 1100 PM EDT... At 1007 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles southeast of Madisonville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Madisonville, Smoky Mountains-Twentymile Creek, Smoky Mountains-Fontana Area, Tellico Plains, Coker Creek, Citico Beach, Tariffville, Mount Vernon, Citico and Deals Gap. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
